p: Throughout the text, the term antiplasmodial is referred to as that which counters the growth of parasites of the genus Plasmodium, while anti-malarial is referred to as an agent which prevents or counteracts the progress of the disease caused by the parasite or that which treats the disease (i.e. by killing the parasites in the host). Very often the two terms are used interchangeably in the literature surveyed.
